note: I write about international human rights law & peacebuilding. Peacemakers Trust director @peacemakers_ca. Former ED & UN rep for Lawyers’ Rights Watch Canada. Other accounts: @eyeoncambodia, @ThailandWatch, @watchingmyanmar, @HRandbusiness, @religionpeace. US news at @USAJusticeWatch. Posting here in my personal capacity. Posts are for research purposes, not endorsement. I use #CW warnings for extremely graphic info. Posts deleted after 7 days.
Expat, ex-law left-coastian fan of Brownian motion trying to write his way out of a paper bag in human and non-human languages. Twitter diaspora. Searchable.

note:
Project Gutenberg, founded in 1971, is the oldest producer and distributor of free ebooks.

According to Michael Hart (March 8, 1947 – September 6, 2011), founder of Project Gutenberg, the mission of Project Gutenberg is simple: to encourage the creation and distribution of eBooks.
This mission is, as much as possible, to encourage all those who are interested in making eBooks and helping to give them away.
